title: Ormanni 2013 Borro del Diavolo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with scents reminiscent of ripe plum, dark culinary spice, balsamic notes and a whiff of espresso. The austere palate is vibrant but a bit lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, licorice and coffee bean framed in bright acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Give it a few more years to come around then drink.

title: OZV 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Oozing with blackberry jam aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a very rich, lightly sweet mouthfeel, tons of blackberry and boysenberry on the palate and a toasty, spicy, lingering finish.

title: Pardon et Fils 2016 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)
description: This is a balanced, structured wine. With ripe tannins and immediately attractive spice and blackberry fruit, it is a warm wine that also has a more serious, textured side. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Pascal Aufranc 2016 En Rémont Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)
description: From the smallest of the Beaujolais crus, this wine brings out the structured nature from the hilly vineyard sites. The wine is solid and firm, crisp with black cherries and black currant. It should age further, so drink from mid-2018.

title: Pierre Amadieu 2015 Roulepierre Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Juicy black cherries and plums abound in this plush, velvety red. It's ripe and full bodied yet brightly balanced in acidity. Firm tannins and savory herb tones linger elegantly on the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Raphael 2014 First Label Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Striking tones of roasted coffee, cocoa and toasty oak ride over a dense core of ripe dark cherry and plum. The palate is silken in feel, with a plush, round texture supported by grainy tannins and bright acidity. More oak shows in the flavors, yet it's integrated among bright cherry, dark currant and granite tones which lead to a lingering dark cocoa finish.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2015 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Bursting aromas of cranberries and red cherries provide a core for a dusting of vanilla, cocoa and herbal spice tones. Medium in weight and well balanced by sandy tannins and bright acidity, the palate is juicy in red fruit, with shades of granite and pepper offering levity.

title: Reyes 2015 Grenache (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: This is the strongest showing yet from this region northeast of Los Angeles, with aromas of berry, hickory smoke, slate and rust on the nose. There is a rustic quality to the sip, with fennel seed-laced salami and macerated plum flavors.

title: Robert Perroud 2016 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)
description: Warm and generous, this is a ripe wine from a steep village behind the hill of Brouilly. The slope gives the wine its hellish name because it is so tough to work. This structure wine offers a core of tannins as well as plenty of black fruits and spice. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Ruttenstock 2016 Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: A tropical touch of ripe mango hovers on the nose of this wine. The palate also has abundant fruit: ripe citrus with hints of juicy pear, yellow plum and again a notion of mango. This is light-footed yet full-fruited and made for easy drinking.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Curtis Vineyards Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Baked blueberry and black cherry meet with black licorice and fresh wisteria florality on the nose of this bottling. The tannic grip is apparent right away on the sip, and a bit strong, but it carries fresh and vibrant black-fruit flavors.

title: Siegel 2013 Unique Selection Red (Colchagua Costa)
description: A rich malty set of aromas is balsamic in a good way, with ripe notes of cassis making the nose not hard to like. A saturated tough palate is fully extracted, maybe a little more so than ideal. Blackened berry and plum flavors finish toasty and peppery, with the fullest of weight making for a chunky final impression.

title: Stift Klosterneuburg 2016 Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: The scent of very ripe russet pear shows prominently on the nose and continues its pervading, fruity charm on the palate. There's just a touch of yeasty texture and a pithy edge. A very ripe, fruit-driven Grüner Veltliner.

title: Tenuta di Nozzole 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, scorched earth, and cooking spice. The lively palate doles out raspberry, black pepper and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Wind Rose 2014 Dolcetto (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine was aged in stainless steel—a rarity for a red in Washington. Aromas of herb, pepper, plum and dark fruit are followed by plump fruit flavors that paint a bit around the edges. There's much to enjoy here, though the middle seems somewhat missing. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.

title: Yealands 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a savory, smoky Pinot, reminiscent of charred greens along with red currents and dried flowers. It's medium-bodied, with a soft grip of salty tannins and bright red fruits.

title: Bishop's Peak 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Grapefruit zest, freshly squeezed lime and a steely minerality show on the nose of this widely available wine made by the Talley family. The palate is tightly wound with more lime skins, but, with time, opens up into flavors of buttered sourdough, marmalade and brioche.

title: Bonterra 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Baking spices and ripe fruit come together to give this medium-bodied wine a big, friendly personality. It feels broad and smooth on the palate and the vanilla, nutmeg and butter notes are as generous in the flavors as in the aromas.

title: Dürnberg 2016 Tradition Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: This wine's shy nose gives little away. The palate comes in with zesty lemon freshness and just a hint of peppery watercress. A light-bodied, refreshing and easy-drinking wine.

title: Fattoria di Lamole 2013 Le Stinche  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas suggesting black cherry, game and underbrush take the lead while the juicy palate offers raspberry jam, clove and star anise. Fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2023.

title: Friedeman 2015 Dichotomy Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a selection of clones and vineyard sites, this affordable varietal wine offers forest pine, cardamom and pomegranate, the fruit elusive within its more savory nature.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Domaine du Pourpre  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This estate, run by the same family for five generations, has produces a structured wine. Its firm tannins and generous black-plum fruits suggest aging potential. Full bodied and rich, the wine should be drunk from 2019.

title: Gracianna 2015 Westside Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from Bacigalupi Vineyard fruit, which is located on Westside Road, this wine offers a generous bouquet and outlay of dark cherry, baked vanilla, toasted oak and forest notes, its heart savory and tart in additional characteristics of clove, cranberry and pomegranate.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Cabernet Franc (San Diego County)
description: Quite light in the glass, this Loire-like bottling shows great promise from San Diego County, with very fresh aromas of cranberry, white pepper and green herbs on the nose. Tart yet candied pomegranate fruit shows on the sip, where that peppery character continues, blending crushed thyme and peppercorn with a touch of caramelized herbs on the finish.

title: Kingston Family 2016 Tobiano Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Cherry aromas dominate the nose on this medium-bodied Pinot with medicinal leanings. A bright youthful palate is more fresh and easy than complex, while this tastes of lightly spiced raspberry, plum and cherry. A juicy appealing finish includes touches of oak and cocoa.

title: Lornano 2013  Chianti Classico
description: Here's a 100% Sangiovese that opens with aromas of woodland berry, underbrush and a hint of balsamic herb. The juicy palate delivers ripe black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Nodland 2014 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, coconut and cherry are followed by well-proportioned fruit and barrel flavors. Cocoa notes linger on the finish. It hits a lot of high marks, though the variety seems a bit hard to find.

title: Notre Dame de Cousignac 2014 White (Luberon)
description: Whispers of caramel, vanilla and salt entice from nose to finish in this slightly savory, full-bodied white. Apple and pear flavors and soft, lemony acidity are delicate in concentration but it's a luscious, richly textured wine that lingers on the finish.

title: Pacific Rim 2016 Vin de Glacieire Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas pop, with appealing notes of marmalade, sugared pineapple and honey. It's sweet and luscious, with abundant apricot and tropical flavors that, despite their sugar, still maintain a sense of elegance and balance.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Soft and elegant on the nose, this bottling presents rounded violets, plump blackberries, broken asphalt and dried dill on the nose. The palate is plush with blueberry and lilac flavors that ride chiseled tannins and benefit from peppercorn and marjoram spices. It is complex and flavorful.
